result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brady Michael Rode appeared by video from DCI.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Brady Michael Rode.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Court takes judicial notice of Washington County case 21CF98; Witness, Det. Eric Engebretsen (HPD), sworn and testified; State rests subject to rebuttal; State moves for bind over, defense objects no further argument; Court puts findings on the record, finds state has met their burden and orders defendant bound over for trial. State confirms victim rights compliance.
